1.verse: The Workers in the Vineyard - ‘So you see,’ Jesus continued, ‘the kingdom of heaven is like a landowner who went out early in the morning to hire workers for his vineyard.

2.verse: He agreed with the workers to give them a dinar a day, and sent them off to his vineyard.

3.verse: ‘He went out again in the middle of the morning, and saw some others standing in the market-place with nothing to do.

4.verse: ‘ “You too can go to the vineyard,” he said, “and I’ll give you what’s right.”

5.verse: So off they went. ‘He went out again about midday, and then in the middle of the afternoon, and did the same.

6.verse: Then, with only an hour of the day left, he went out and found other people standing there. ‘ “Why are you standing here all day with nothing to do?” he asked them.

7.verse: ‘ “Because no one has hired us,” they replied. ‘ “Well,” he said, “you too can go into the vineyard.”

8.verse: ‘When evening came, the vineyard-owner said to his servant, “Call the workers and give them their pay. Start with the last, and go on to the first.”

9.verse: ‘So the ones who had worked for one hour came, and each of them received a dinar.

10.verse: When the first ones came, they thought they would get something more; but they, too, each received a dinar.

11.verse: ‘When they had been given it, they grumbled against the landowner.

12.verse: “This lot who came in last”, they said, “have only worked for one hour – and they’ve been put on a level with us! And we did all the hard work, all day, and in the heat as well!”

13.verse: ‘ “My friend,” he said to one of them, “I’m not doing you any wrong. You agreed with me on one dinar, didn’t you?

14.verse: Take it! It’s yours! And be on your way. I want to give this fellow who came at the end the same as you.

15.verse: Or are you suggesting that I’m not allowed to do what I like with my own money? Or are you giving me the evil eye because I’m good?”

21.verse: ‘What d’you want?’ he asked her. ‘It’s about these two sons of mine,’ she said to him. ‘Please say that, when you’re king, they may sit, one at your right hand and one at your left.’

22.verse: ‘You don’t know what you’re asking for,’ said Jesus. ‘Can you two drink the cup I’m going to drink?’ ‘Yes, we can,’ they replied.

23.verse: ‘Well,’ said Jesus, ‘so you will drink my cup, then! But sitting at my right and left is not something I can grant. That’s up to my father to give to whoever he has in mind.’

24.verse: When the other ten heard this they were annoyed with the two brothers.

25.verse: But Jesus called them together. ‘You know how it is with pagan rulers,’ he said. ‘They lord it over their subjects. They get all high and mighty and let everybody know it.

26.verse: But that’s not how it’s to be with you. If any of you wants to be great, he must be your servant.

27.verse: If any of you wants to be first, he must be the slave of all.

28.verse: That’s how it is with the son of man: he didn’t come to have servants obey him, but to be a servant – and to give his life as “a ransom for many”.’

29.verse: The Healing of Two Blind Men - As they were going out of Jericho, a large crowd was following Jesus.

30.verse: Just then two blind men were sitting by the wayside, and heard that Jesus was going by. ‘Have pity on us, Master, son of David!’ they shouted.

31.verse: The crowd scolded them and told them to be silent. But they shouted out all the more, ‘Have pity on us, Master, son of David!’

32.verse: Jesus came to a stop. He called them. ‘What d’you want me to do for you?’ he asked.

33.verse: ‘Master,’ they replied, ‘we want you to open our eyes.’

34.verse: Jesus was very moved. He touched their eyes. At once they could see again, and they followed him.

1.verse: Jesus Rides into Jerusalem - When they came near to Jerusalem, and arrived at Bethphage on the Mount of Olives, Jesus sent two of the disciples on ahead.

2.verse: ‘Go into the village over there,’ he said, ‘and at once you’ll find a donkey tied up, and a foal beside it. Untie them and bring them to me.

3.verse: And if anyone says anything to you, say, “The master needs them, and he’ll send them back straight away.” ’ He sent them off at once.

4.verse: This happened so that the prophet’s words might be fulfilled:

5.verse: Tell this to Zion’s daughter: look now! Here comes your king; he’s humble, mounted on an ass, yes, on a foal, its young.

6.verse: So the disciples went off and did as Jesus had told them.

7.verse: They brought the donkey and its foal, and put their cloaks on them, and Jesus sat on them.

8.verse: The huge crowd spread their cloaks on the road. Others cut branches from the trees and scattered them on the road.

9.verse: The crowds who went on ahead of him, and those who were following behind, shouted out, Hosanna now to David’s Son! God’s blessing on the coming one – the one who comes in the Lord’s own name! Hosanna in the highest!

10.verse: When they came into Jerusalem, the whole city was gripped with excitement. ‘Who is this?’ they were saying.

11.verse: ‘This is the prophet, Jesus,’ replied the crowds, ‘from Nazareth in Galilee!’

12.verse: The Temple and the Fig Tree - Jesus went into the Temple and threw out all the people who were buying and selling in the Temple. He upturned the tables of the money-changers and the seats of the dove-sellers.

13.verse: ‘This is what the Bible says,’ he said to them, My house will be called a house of prayer – but you have made it a brigands’ lair!’

14.verse: The blind and the lame came to him in the Temple, and he healed them.

15.verse: But when the chief priests and the scribes saw the remarkable things he was doing, and the children shouting out ‘Hosanna to David’s son!’ in the Temple, they were very cross.

16.verse: ‘Do you hear what they’re saying?’ they asked Jesus. ‘Yes,’ said Jesus. ‘Did you never read what it says, You called forth praise to rise to you from newborn babes and infants too!’

17.verse: Then he left them, and went out of the city to Bethany, where he stayed the night.

18.verse: Early the next morning Jesus went back to the city. He was hungry.

19.verse: He saw a single fig tree beside the road, but when he came up to it he found nothing on it except leaves. ‘May you never bear fruit, ever again!’ he said to it. Instantly the fig tree withered up.

20.verse: The disciples saw it, and were astonished. ‘Look how quickly the fig tree has withered up!’ they said.

21.verse: ‘I’m telling you the truth,’ replied Jesus. ‘If you have faith, and don’t doubt, you will not only be able to do this to a fig tree, but if you say to this mountain, “Be lifted up and thrown into the sea”, it will happen.

22.verse: Whatever you ask in prayer, you’ll get it, if you believe.’

23.verse: The Question about John - Jesus went into the Temple. As he was teaching, the chief priests and the elders of the people came up to him. ‘By what right are you doing these things?’ they asked him. ‘Who gave you this right?’

24.verse: ‘I’m going to ask you one question, too,’ replied Jesus, ‘and if you tell me the answer then I’ll tell you by what right I’m doing these things.

25.verse: Where did John’s baptism come from? Was it from heaven, or from this world?’ They debated this among themselves. ‘If we say “from heaven”,’ they said, ‘he’s going to say to us, “So why didn’t you believe him?”

26.verse: But if we say “from this world”, we’ll have to watch out for the crowd, because they all reckon that John was a prophet.’

27.verse: So they answered Jesus, ‘We don’t know.’ ‘Well, then,’ said Jesus, ‘nor will I tell you by what right I’m doing these things.’

28.verse: ‘What d’you think?’ he went on. ‘Once upon a time there was a man who had two sons. ‘He went to the first one and said, “Now then, my boy, off you go and do a day’s work in the vineyard.”

29.verse: ‘ “Don’t want to,” replied the son; but afterwards he thought better of it and went.

30.verse: ‘He went to the other son and said the same thing. ‘ “Certainly, Master,” he said; but he didn’t go.

31.verse: ‘So which of the two did what his father wanted?’ ‘The first,’ they answered. ‘I’m telling you the truth,’ Jesus said to them. ‘The tax-collectors and prostitutes are going into God’s kingdom ahead of you!

32.verse: Yes: John came to you, in accordance with God’s righteous covenant plan, and you didn’t believe him – but the tax-collectors and prostitutes believed him. But when you saw it, you didn’t think better of it afterwards and believe him.’

33.verse: The Parable of the Tenants - ‘Listen to another parable,’ Jesus went on. ‘Once upon a time there was a householder who planted a vineyard, built a wall for it, dug out a wine-press in it, and built a tower. Then he let it out to tenant farmers and went away on a journey.

34.verse: ‘When harvest time arrived, he sent his slaves to the farmers to collect his produce.

35.verse: The farmers seized his slaves; they beat one, killed another, and stoned another.

36.verse: Again he sent other slaves, more than before, and they treated them in the same way.

37.verse: Finally he sent his son to them. ‘ “They’ll respect my son,” he said.

38.verse: ‘But the farmers saw the son. ‘ “This fellow’s the heir!” they said among themselves. “Come on, let’s kill him, and then we can take over the property!”

39.verse: ‘So they seized him, threw him out of the vineyard, and killed him.

40.verse: ‘Now then: when the vineyard-owner returns, what will he do to those farmers?’

41.verse: ‘He’ll kill them brutally, the wretches!’ they said. ‘And he’ll lease the vineyard to other farmers who’ll give him the produce at the right time.’

42.verse: ‘Did you never read what the Bible says?’ said Jesus to them: The stone the builders threw away is now atop the corner; it’s from the Lord, all this, they say and we looked on in wonder.

43.verse: ‘So then let me tell you this: God’s kingdom is going to be taken away from you and given to a nation that will produce the goods.

44.verse: Anyone who falls on this stone will be smashed to pieces, and anyone it falls on will be crushed.’

45.verse: When the chief priests and the Pharisees heard his parables, they knew he was talking about them.

46.verse: They tried to arrest him, but they were afraid of the crowds, who regarded him as a prophet.

1.verse: The Parable of the Wedding Feast - Jesus spoke to them once again in parables.

2.verse: ‘The kingdom of heaven’, he said, ‘is like a king who made a wedding feast for his son.

3.verse: He sent his slaves to call the invited guests to the wedding, and they didn’t want to come.

4.verse: ‘Again he sent other slaves, with these instructions: “Say to the guests, Look! I’ve got my dinner ready; my bulls and fatted calves have been killed; everything is prepared. Come to the wedding!”

5.verse: ‘But they didn’t take any notice. They went off, one to his own farm, another to see to his business.

6.verse: The others laid hands on his slaves, abused them and killed them.

7.verse: (The king was angry, and sent his soldiers to destroy those murderers and burn down their city.)

8.verse: Then he said to his slaves, “The wedding is ready, but the guests didn’t deserve it.

9.verse: So go to the roads leading out of town, and invite everyone you find to the wedding.”

10.verse: The slaves went off into the streets and rounded up everyone they found, bad and good alike. And the wedding was filled with partygoers.

11.verse: ‘But when the king came in to look at the guests, he saw there a man who wasn’t wearing a wedding suit.

12.verse: ‘ “My friend,” he said to him, “how did you get in here without a wedding suit?” And he was speechless.

13.verse: Then the king said to the servants, “Tie him up, hands and feet, and throw him into the darkness outside, where people weep and grind their teeth.”

14.verse: ‘Many are called, you see, but few are chosen.’

15.verse: Paying Taxes to Caesar - Then the Pharisees went and plotted how they might trap him into saying the wrong thing.

16.verse: They sent their followers to him, with the Herodians. ‘Teacher,’ they said, ‘we know that you are truthful, and that you teach God’s way truthfully. You don’t care what anyone thinks about you, because you don’t try to flatter people or favour them.

17.verse: So tell us what you think. Is it lawful to pay tribute to Caesar, or not?’

18.verse: Jesus knew their evil intentions. ‘Why are you trying to trick me, you hypocrites?’ he said.

19.verse: ‘Show me the tribute coin.’ They brought him a dinar.

20.verse: ‘This . . . image,’ said Jesus, ‘and this . . . inscription. Who do they belong to?’

21.verse: ‘Caesar,’ they said. ‘Well then,’ said Jesus, ‘you’d better give Caesar back what belongs to Caesar! And – give God what belongs to God!’

22.verse: When they heard that they were astonished. They left him and went away.

23.verse: The Question of the Resurrection - The same day some Sadducees came to him. (The Sadducees deny the resurrection.) Their question was this.

24.verse: ‘Teacher,’ they began, ‘Moses said, “If a man dies without children, his brother should marry his widow and raise up seed for his brother.”

25.verse: Well now, there were seven brothers living among us. The first got married, and then died, and since he didn’t have children he left his wife to his brother.

26.verse: The same thing happened with the second and the third, and so on with all seven.

27.verse: Last of all the woman died.

28.verse: So: in the resurrection, whose wife will she be, of all the seven? All of them had married her, after all.’

29.verse: This was Jesus’ answer to them: ‘You are quite mistaken,’ he said, ‘because you don’t know your Bibles or God’s power.

30.verse: In the resurrection, you see, people don’t marry or get married off; they are like angels in heaven.

31.verse: But as for the resurrection of the dead, did you never read what was said to you by God, in these words:

32.verse: “I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob?” He isn’t God of the dead, but of the living.’

33.verse: The crowds heard this, and they were astonished at his teaching.

34.verse: The Great Commandment, and David’s Master - When the Pharisees heard that Jesus had silenced the Sadducees, they got together in a group.

35.verse: One of them, a lawyer, put him on the spot with this question.

36.verse: ‘Teacher,’ he said, ‘which is the most important commandment in the law?’

37.verse: ‘You must love the Lord your God’, replied Jesus, ‘with all your heart, with all your life, and with all your mind.

38.verse: This is the first commandment, and it’s the one that really matters.

39.verse: The second is similar, and it’s this: You must love your neighbour as yourself.

40.verse: The entire law hangs on these two commandments – and that goes for the prophets, too.’

41.verse: While the Pharisees were gathered there, Jesus asked them,

42.verse: ‘What’s your view of the Messiah? Whose son is he?’ ‘David’s,’ they said to him.

43.verse: ‘Why then’, said Jesus, ‘does David (speaking by the spirit) call him “Master”, when he says,

44.verse: The Master says to my master, sit here at my right hand, until I place your enemies down beneath your feet.

45.verse: ‘If David calls him “Master”, how can he be his son?’

46.verse: Nobody was able to answer him a single word. From that day on nobody dared ask him anything any more.

1.verse: Warnings against Scribes and Pharisees - Then Jesus spoke to the crowds and to his disciples:

2.verse: ‘The scribes and Pharisees’, he said, ‘sit on the seat of Moses.

3.verse: So you must do whatever they tell you, and keep it, but don’t do the things they do. You see, they talk but they don’t do.

4.verse: They tie up heavy bundles which are difficult to carry, and they dump them on people’s shoulders – but they themselves aren’t prepared to lift a little finger to move them!

5.verse: ‘Everything they do is for show, to be seen by people. Yes, they make their prayer-boxes large and their prayer-tassels long,

6.verse: and they love the chief places at dinners, the main seats in the synagogues,

7.verse: the greetings in the market-places, and having people call them “Rabbi”.

8.verse: ‘You mustn’t be called “Rabbi”. You have one teacher, and you are all one family.

9.verse: And you shouldn’t call anyone “father” on earth, because you have one father, in heaven.

10.verse: Nor should you be called “teacher”, because you have one teacher, the Messiah.

11.verse: ‘The greatest among you should be your servant.

12.verse: People who make themselves great will be humbled; and people who humble themselves will become great.’

13.verse: Condemnation of Scribes and Pharisees (1) - ‘Woe betide you, scribes and Pharisees, you hypocrites!’ Jesus continued. ‘You lock up the kingdom of heaven in front of people’s faces. You don’t go in yourselves, and when other people try to enter, you stop them.

14.verse: verse doesn't exist in this bible version

15.verse: ‘Woe betide you, scribes and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You cross sea and land to make one single Gentile take up Judaism, and when that happens you make the convert twice as much a child of Gehenna as you are yourselves.

16.verse: ‘Woe betide you, you blind guides! This is what you say: “If anyone swears by the Temple, it’s nothing; but if anyone swears by the gold in the Temple, the oath is valid.”

17.verse: How crazy and blind can you get! Which is greater, the gold, or the Temple that makes the gold sacred?

18.verse: And you say, “If anyone swears by the altar, it’s nothing; but if anyone swears by the gift on it, the oath is valid.”

19.verse: How blind you are! Which is greater, the gift, or the altar that makes the gift sacred?

20.verse: So whoever swears by the altar swears by it and by everything on it.

21.verse: And whoever swears by the Temple swears by it and by the one who lives in it.

22.verse: And whoever swears by heaven swears by the throne of God and by the one who sits on it.’

23.verse: Condemnation of Scribes and Pharisees (2) - ‘Woe betide you, scribes and Pharisees, you hypocrites!’ Jesus went on. ‘You tithe mint and dill and cummin, and you omit the serious matters of the law like justice, mercy and loyalty. You should have done these, without neglecting the others.

24.verse: You’re blind guides! You filter out a gnat, but you gulp down a camel!

25.verse: ‘Woe betide you, scribes and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You scrub the outside of the cup and the dish, but the inside is full of extortion and moral flabbiness.

26.verse: You blind Pharisee, first make the inside of the cup clean, and then the outside will be clean as well.

27.verse: ‘Woe betide you, scribes and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You’re like whitewashed graves, which look very fine on the outside, but inside they are full of the bones of the dead and uncleanness of every kind.

28.verse: That’s like you: on the outside you appear to be virtuous and law-abiding, but inside you are full of hypocrisy and lawlessness.

29.verse: ‘Woe betide you, scribes and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You build the tombs of the prophets, and you decorate the memorials of the righteous,

30.verse: and you say, “If we’d lived in the days of our ancestors, we wouldn’t have gone along with them in killing the prophets.”

31.verse: So you testify against yourselves that you are the children of the people who murdered the prophets!

32.verse: Well then, go ahead: complete the work your ancestors began!

33.verse: You snakes, you nest of vipers, how can you escape the judgment of Gehenna?’

34.verse: Judgment on Jerusalem and Its Leaders - ‘Because of all this,’ Jesus concluded, ‘I’m sending you prophets, wise men and scribes. Some of them you will kill and crucify. Some of them you will whip in your synagogues. You’ll chase them from town to town.

35.verse: That’s how all the righteous blood that’s been shed on earth, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zechariah son of Barachiah – you murdered him between sanctuary and altar – all that blood will come upon you.

36.verse: I’m telling you the solemn truth: it will all come on this generation.

37.verse: ‘Jerusalem, Jerusalem, killing the prophets and stoning those who are sent to you! How often have I longed to gather up your children, the way a hen gathers up her brood under her wings, and you didn’t want me to!

38.verse: Now, see here: your house has been abandoned by God; it’s a ruin.

39.verse: Yes, I tell you: you won’t see me again from now on until you say, “God’s blessing on the coming one, the one who comes in the Lord’s own name!” ’

1.verse: The Beginning of the Birth Pangs - Jesus left the Temple and went away. As he did so, his disciples came and pointed out the Temple buildings to him.

2.verse: ‘Yes,’ he said, ‘and you see all these things? I’m telling you the truth: not one stone will be left standing upon another. All of them will be thrown down.’

3.verse: As he was sitting on the Mount of Olives, his disciples came to him privately. ‘Tell us,’ they said, ‘when will these things happen? And what will be the sign that you are going to appear as king, and that the end of the age is upon us?’

4.verse: ‘Watch out,’ replied Jesus. ‘Don’t let anyone deceive you.

5.verse: You see, there will be several who will come along, using my name, telling you “I’m the Messiah!” They will fool lots of people.

6.verse: You’re going to hear about wars, actual wars and rumoured ones; make sure you don’t get alarmed. This has got to happen, but it doesn’t mean the end is coming yet.

7.verse: Nations will rise against one another, and kingdoms against each other. There will be famines and earthquakes here and there.

8.verse: All this is just the start of the birthpangs.

9.verse: ‘Then they will hand you over to be tortured, and they will kill you. You will be hated by all nations because of my name.

10.verse: Then several will find the going too hard, and they will betray each other and hate each other.

11.verse: Many false prophets will arise, and they will deceive plenty of people.

12.verse: And because lawlessness will be on the increase, many will find their love growing cold.

13.verse: But the one who lasts out to the end will be delivered.

14.verse: And this gospel of the kingdom must be announced to the whole world, as a witness to all the nations. Then the end will come.’

15.verse: The Desolating Sacrilege - ‘So when you see “the sacrilege that desolates”, as Daniel the prophet put it, “standing in the holy place” (the reader should understand),

16.verse: then those who are in Judaea should take to their heels and run to the mountains.

17.verse: If you’re up on your roof, don’t go down into the house to get things out.

18.verse: If you’re in the fields, don’t go back to pick up your cloak.

19.verse: It’s going to be terrible for pregnant and nursing women during those days.

20.verse: Pray that it won’t be winter when you have to run away, or for that matter a sabbath.

21.verse: Yes: there’s going to be such great suffering then as has never been since the start of the world until now – no, and won’t ever be again.

22.verse: And if those days had not been shortened, nobody at all would have been rescued. But for the sake of God’s chosen ones those days will be shortened.

23.verse: ‘Then if anyone says to you, “Look! Here is the Messiah!” or “Look! There he is!”, don’t believe them.

24.verse: False messiahs will arise, you see, and false prophets too. They will provide great signs and portents, so as to deceive even God’s chosen ones, if that were possible.

25.verse: Remember, I’m telling you this beforehand!

26.verse: ‘So if someone says to you, “Look! He’s out in the wilderness”, don’t go out. If they say, “Look, he’s in the inner room”, don’t believe them.

27.verse: You see, the royal appearing of the son of man will be like the lightning that comes from the East and flashes across to the West.

28.verse: Where the carcass is, there the vultures will gather.’

29.verse: The Coming of the Son of Man - ‘Straight away,’ Jesus continued, ‘after the suffering that those days will bring, The sun will turn to darkness, and the moon won’t give its light; the stars will fall from heaven, and the powers of heaven will shake.

30.verse: ‘And then the sign of the son of man will appear in heaven; then all the tribes of the earth will mourn. They will see “the son of man coming on the clouds of heaven” with power and great glory.

31.verse: He will send off his messengers with a great trumpet-blast, and they will collect his chosen ones from the four winds, from one end of heaven to the other.

32.verse: ‘Learn the hidden meaning from the fig tree. When its branch begins to sprout, and to push out its leaves, then you know that summer is nearly there.

33.verse: So with you: when you see all these things, you will know that it is near, at the very gates.

34.verse: I’m telling you the truth: this generation won’t be gone before all these things happen.

35.verse: Heaven and earth will disappear, but my words will never, ever disappear.’

36.verse: The Unexpected Coming - ‘Nobody knows what day or time this will happen,’ Jesus went on. ‘The angels in heaven don’t know it, and nor does the son; only the father knows.

37.verse: You see, the royal appearing of the son of man will be like the days of Noah.

38.verse: ‘What does that mean? Well, in those days, before the flood, they were eating and drinking, they were getting married and giving children in marriage, right up to the day when Noah went into the ark.

39.verse: They didn’t know about it until the flood came and swept them all away. That’s what it’ll be like at the royal appearing of the son of man.

40.verse: ‘On that day there will be two people working in the field. One will be taken, the other will be left.

41.verse: There will be two women grinding corn in the mill. One will be taken, the other will be left.

42.verse: ‘So keep alert! You don’t know what day your master will come.

43.verse: But bear this in mind: if the householder had known what time of night the burglar was going to come, he would have stayed awake and wouldn’t have let his house get broken into.

44.verse: So you too must be ready! The son of man is coming at a time you don’t expect.’

45.verse: The Wise and Wicked Slaves - ‘So,’ Jesus went on, ‘who then is the trustworthy and sensible slave, the one the master will set over his household, so that he will give them their meals at the right time?

46.verse: Blessings on the servant whom the master, when he comes, finds doing just that.

47.verse: I’m telling you the truth: he’ll promote him to be over all his belongings.

48.verse: But if the wicked slave says in his heart, “My master’s taking his time”,

49.verse: and starts to beat the other slaves, and to feast and drink with the drunkards,

50.verse: the master of that slave will come on a day he doesn’t expect, and at a time he doesn’t know.

51.verse: He will cut him in two, and put him along with the hypocrites, where people will weep and grind their teeth.’

1.verse: The Wise and Foolish Girls - ‘Then,’ continued Jesus, ‘the kingdom of heaven will be like ten girls who each took their own torches and went out to meet the bridegroom.

2.verse: Five of them were silly, and five were sensible.

3.verse: The silly ones took their torches, but didn’t take oil with them.

4.verse: The sensible ones took oil, in flasks, along with their torches.

5.verse: ‘The bridegroom took his time coming, and they all nodded off and went to sleep.

6.verse: In the middle of the night a shout went up: “Here’s the bridegroom! Come on and meet him!”

7.verse: Then all the girls got up and trimmed the wicks of their torches.

8.verse: ‘The silly ones said to the sensible ones, “Give us some of your oil! Our torches are going out!”

9.verse: ‘But the sensible ones answered, “No! If we do that, there won’t be enough for all of us together! You’d better go to the dealers and buy some for yourselves.”

10.verse: ‘So off they went to buy oil. But, while they were gone, the bridegroom arrived. The ones who were ready went in with him to the wedding party, and the door was shut.

11.verse: ‘Later on the other girls came back. “Master, Master!” they said, “open the door for us!”

12.verse: ‘ “I’m telling you the truth,” he said, “I don’t know you.”

13.verse: ‘So keep awake! You don’t know the day or the hour.’

14.verse: The Parable of the Talents - ‘This is what it will be like,’ Jesus went on. ‘It will be like a man who was going off on a journey. He summoned his slaves, and handed over control of his property to them.

15.verse: He gave five talents to the first, two to the next, and one to the last – each according to his ability. Then he left. ‘Straight away

16.verse: the man who had been given the five talents went out and traded with them, and made five more.

17.verse: Similarly, the one who had received two talents went and made another two.

18.verse: But the one who received a single talent went and dug a hole in the ground, and hid his master’s money.

19.verse: ‘After a long time, the master of those slaves came back and settled accounts with them.

20.verse: The man who had received five talents came forward and gave him the other five talents. “Master,” he said, “you gave me five talents. Look: I’ve made another five!”

21.verse: “Well done indeed,” said his master. “You’re an excellent slave, and loyal too! You’ve been trustworthy with small things, and now I’m going to put you in charge of bigger ones. Come and join your master’s celebration!”

22.verse: ‘Then the man who had had the two talents came forward. “Master,” he said, “you gave me two talents. Look: I’ve made another two!”

23.verse: “Well done indeed,” said his master. “You’re an excellent slave, and loyal too! You’ve been trustworthy with small things, and now I’m going to put you in charge of bigger ones. Come and join your master’s celebration!”

24.verse: ‘Then the man who had had the one talent came forward. “Master,” he said, “I knew that you were a hard man. You reap where you didn’t sow, and you profit from things you never invested in.

25.verse: So I was scared! I went and hid your talent in the ground. Here it is: it’s yours, you can have it back.”

26.verse: ‘ “You’re a wicked and lazy slave!” answered his master. “So! You knew that I reap where I didn’t sow, and profit from investments I never made?

27.verse: Then you should have put my money with the bankers, and when I returned I would have received back what I had with interest!

28.verse: ‘ “So take the talent from him,” he went on, “and give it to the man who has ten talents.”

29.verse: (If someone already has something, you see, they will be given more, and they’ll have plenty. But if someone has nothing, even what they have will be taken away from them.)

30.verse: “But as for this useless slave, throw him outside in the dark, where people weep and grind their teeth.” ’

31.verse: The Sheep and the Goats - ‘When the son of man comes in his glory,’ Jesus went on, ‘and all the angels with him, then he will sit on his glorious throne.

32.verse: All the nations will be assembled in front of him, and he will separate them from one another, like a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.

33.verse: He will stand the sheep at his right hand, and the goats at his left.

34.verse: ‘Then the king will say to those on his right, “Come here, you people who my father has blessed. Inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world!

35.verse: Why? Because I was hungry and you gave me something to eat. I was thirsty and you gave me something to drink. I was a stranger and you made me welcome.

36.verse: I was naked and you clothed me; I was sick and you looked after me; I was in prison and you came to me.”

37.verse: ‘Then the righteous will answer him, “Master, when did we see you hungry and feed you, or thirsty and give you a drink?

38.verse: When did we see you a stranger and welcome you, or naked and clothe you?

39.verse: When did we see you sick or in prison and come to see you?”

40.verse: ‘Then the king will answer them, “I’m telling you the truth: when you did it to one of the least significant of my brothers and sisters here, you did it to me.”

41.verse: ‘Then he will say to those on his left hand, “Get away from me! You’re accursed! Go to the everlasting fire prepared for the devil and his angels!

42.verse: Why? Because I was hungry and you gave me nothing to eat! I was thirsty and you gave me nothing to drink!

43.verse: I was a stranger and you didn’t welcome me; I was naked and you didn’t clothe me; I was sick and in prison and you didn’t look after me!”

44.verse: ‘Then they too will answer, “Master, when did we see you hungry or thirsty, or a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and didn’t do anything for you?”

45.verse: ‘Then he will answer them, “I’m telling you the truth: when you didn’t do it for one of the least significant of my brothers and sisters here, you didn’t do it for me.”

46.verse: ‘And they will go away into everlasting punishment, but the righteous will go into everlasting life.’

1.verse: Preparations for Jesus’ Death - So this is how it finally happened. When Jesus had finished all these sayings, he said to his disciples,

2.verse: ‘In two days’ time, as you know, it’ll be Passover! That’s when the son of man will be handed over to be crucified.’

3.verse: Then the chief priests got together with the elders of the people, in the official residence of the high priest, who was called Caiaphas.

4.verse: They plotted how to capture Jesus by some trick, and kill him.

5.verse: ‘We’d better not try anything at the feast,’ they said. ‘We don’t want the people to riot.’

6.verse: While Jesus was at Bethany, in the house of Simon (known as ‘the Leper’),

7.verse: a woman came to him who had an alabaster vase of extremely valuable ointment. She poured it on his head as he was reclining at the table.

8.verse: When the disciples saw it, they were furious. ‘What’s the point of all this waste?’ they said.

9.verse: ‘This could have been sold for a fortune, and the money could have been given to the poor!’

10.verse: Jesus knew what they were thinking. ‘Why make life difficult for the woman?’ he said. ‘It’s a lovely thing, what she’s done for me.

11.verse: You always have the poor with you, don’t you? But you won’t always have me.

12.verse: When she poured this ointment on my body, you see, she did it to prepare me for my burial.

13.verse: I’m telling you the truth: wherever this gospel is announced in all the world, what she has just done will be told, and people will remember her.’

14.verse: Passover and Betrayal - Then one of the Twelve, called Judas Iscariot, went to the chief priests.

15.verse: ‘What will you give me’, he said, ‘to hand him over to you?’ They settled the deal with him at thirty pieces of silver.

16.verse: From that moment on, he was watching for an opportunity to hand him over.

17.verse: On the first day of the Feast of Unleavened Bread, the disciples said to Jesus, ‘Where do you want us to get the Passover ready for you to eat it?’

18.verse: ‘Go into the city’, he said, ‘to a certain man, and say to him, “The Teacher says, ‘My time is very close. I’m going to keep the Passover at your house with my disciples.’ ” ’

19.verse: So the disciples did as Jesus had told them, and got the Passover ready.

20.verse: When evening came, he settled down with the Twelve.

21.verse: As they were eating, he said, ‘I’m telling you the truth: one of you will betray me.’

22.verse: They were extremely upset, and began to say one by one, ‘It’s not me, is it, Master?’

23.verse: ‘It’s one who’s dipped his hand with me in the dish,’ Jesus replied. ‘That’s the one who will betray me.

24.verse: The son of man is on his way, as the Bible said it would happen, but it’s misery for the man who hands him over. It would be better for that man if he’d never been born.’

25.verse: At this, Judas, who was planning to betray him, said, ‘It isn’t me, is it, Teacher?’ ‘You’ve just said so,’ he replied.

26.verse: The Last Supper - As they were eating, Jesus took some bread, blessed it, broke it and gave it to the disciples. ‘Take it and eat it,’ he said, ‘this is my body.’

27.verse: Then he took a cup; and, after giving thanks, he gave it to them. ‘Drink this, all of you,’ he said.

28.verse: ‘This is my blood of the covenant, which is poured out for many for the forgiveness of sins.

29.verse: But let me tell you this: I will not drink any more from this fruit of the vine, until that day when I drink it new with you in the kingdom of my father.’

30.verse: They sang a hymn, and went out to the Mount of Olives.

31.verse: Then Jesus said to them, ‘You are all going to stumble and fall tonight because of me. This is what the Bible says, you see: I shall strike the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock will be scattered.

32.verse: ‘But after I am raised up, I shall go on ahead of you to Galilee.’

33.verse: ‘Even if everyone else trips and falls,’ said Peter in reply to him, ‘I’m never going to do that!’

34.verse: ‘I’m telling you the truth,’ said Jesus to him, ‘this very night, before the cock has crowed, you will deny me three times.’

35.verse: ‘Even if I have to die with you,’ said Peter to him, ‘I won’t ever deny you!’ And all the disciples said the same.

36.verse: Gethsemane - So Jesus went with them to the place called Gethsemane. ‘You sit here,’ he said to the disciples, ‘while I go over there and pray.’

37.verse: He took Peter and the two sons of Zebedee with him, and began to be very upset and distressed.

38.verse: ‘My soul is overwhelmed with grief,’ he said, ‘even to death. Stay here and keep watch with me.’

39.verse: Then, going a little further on, he fell on his face and prayed. ‘My father,’ he said, ‘if it’s possible – please, please let this cup go away from me! But . . . not what I want, but what you want.’

40.verse: He came back to the disciples and found them asleep. ‘So,’ he said to Peter, ‘couldn’t you keep watch with me for a single hour?

41.verse: Watch and pray so that you don’t get pulled down into the time of testing. The spirit is eager, but the body is weak.’

42.verse: Again, for the second time, he went off and said, ‘My father, if it’s not possible for this to pass unless I drink it, let your will be done.’

43.verse: Again he came and found them asleep; their eyes were heavy.

44.verse: Once more he left them and went away. He prayed for the third time, using the same words once again.

45.verse: Then he came back to the disciples. ‘You can sleep now,’ he said, ‘and have a good rest! Look – the time has come, and the son of man is given over into the hands of wicked people!

46.verse: Get up and let’s be going. Look! Here comes the one who’s going to betray me!’

47.verse: Jesus Is Arrested - While Jesus was still speaking, there was Judas, one of the Twelve. He had come with a large crowd, with swords and clubs, from the chief priests and the elders of the people.

48.verse: The one who was intending to betray him gave them a sign: ‘The one I kiss – that’s him! Grab hold of him!’

49.verse: So he went up at once to Jesus and said ‘Greetings, Teacher!’, and kissed him.

50.verse: ‘My friend,’ said Jesus, ‘what have you come to do?’ Then they came and laid hands on Jesus, and arrested him.

51.verse: At that, one of the men with Jesus reached out his hand, drew his sword and hit the high priest’s slave, cutting off his ear.

52.verse: ‘Put your sword back where it belongs!’ said Jesus to him. ‘People who use the sword die by the sword!

53.verse: Don’t you realize that I could call on my father and have him send me more than twelve legions of angels, just like that?

54.verse: But how then can the Bible come true when it says this has to happen?’

55.verse: At that time Jesus said to the crowds, ‘Have you really come out with swords and sticks to arrest me, as if I were some kind of brigand? I sat there teaching in the Temple every day, and you didn’t arrest me!

56.verse: But all this has happened so that the writings of the prophets would be fulfilled.’ Then all the disciples abandoned him and ran away.

57.verse: Jesus Before Caiaphas - The people who had arrested Jesus took him off to Caiaphas the high priest. The scribes and elders had already gathered at his house.

58.verse: Peter, however, followed him at some distance, all the way to the high priest’s residence. He went in and sat with the servants, to see how things would work out.

59.verse: The high priest and the whole Council tried to produce false evidence against Jesus, to frame a capital charge and have him killed.

60.verse: But even though they brought in plenty of lying witnesses, they couldn’t find the evidence they wanted. Finally two people came forward

61.verse: and declared: ‘This fellow said, “I can destroy God’s Temple and build it again in three days!” ’

62.verse: Then the high priest stood up. ‘Aren’t you going to answer?’ he said to him. ‘What are these people accusing you of?’

63.verse: But Jesus remained silent. Then the high priest said to him, ‘I put you on oath before the living God: tell us if you are the Messiah, God’s son!’

64.verse: ‘You said the words,’ replied Jesus. ‘But let me tell you this: from now on you will see “the son of man sitting at the right hand of the Power, and coming on the clouds of heaven”.’

65.verse: Then the high priest tore his robes. ‘He’s blasphemed!’ he said. ‘Why do we need any more witnesses? Look – you’ve heard his blasphemy, here and now!

66.verse: What’s your verdict?’ ‘He deserves to die,’ they answered.

67.verse: Then they spat in his face and hit him. Some of them slapped him,

68.verse: and said, ‘Prophesy for us, Mr Messiah! Who was it who hit you?’

69.verse: Peter’s Denial - Meanwhile, Peter sat outside in the courtyard. One of the servant-girls came up to him. ‘You were with Jesus the Galilean too, weren’t you?’ she said.

70.verse: He denied it in front of everyone. ‘I don’t know what you’re talking about,’ he said.

71.verse: He went out to the gateway. Another girl saw him, and said to the people who were there, ‘This fellow was with Jesus the Nazarene!’

72.verse: Once more he denied it, this time swearing, ‘I don’t know the man!’

73.verse: After a little while the people standing around came up and said to Peter, ‘You really are one of them! Look – the way you talk makes it obvious!’

74.verse: Then he began to curse and swear, ‘I don’t know the man!’ And then, all at once, the cock crowed.

75.verse: And Peter remembered. He remembered the words Jesus had spoken to him: ‘Before the cock crows, you will deny me three times.’ And he went outside and cried like a baby.

1.verse: The Death of Judas - When dawn broke, all the chief priests and elders of the people held a council meeting about Jesus, in order to have him put to death.

2.verse: They tied him up, took him off, and handed him over to Pilate, the governor.

3.verse: Meanwhile Judas, who had betrayed him, saw that he had been condemned, and was filled with remorse. He took the thirty pieces of silver back to the high priests and elders.

4.verse: ‘I’ve sinned!’ he said. ‘I betrayed an innocent man, and now I’ve got his blood on my hands!’ ‘See if we care!’ they replied. ‘Deal with it yourself.’

5.verse: And he threw down the money in the Temple, and left, and went and hanged himself.

6.verse: ‘Well now,’ said the chief priests, picking up the money. ‘According to the law, we can’t put it into the Temple treasury. It’s the price of someone’s blood.’

7.verse: So they had a discussion, and used it to buy the Potter’s Field, as a burial place for foreigners.

8.verse: (That’s why that field is called Blood Field, to this day.)

9.verse: Then the word that was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet came true: They took the thirty pieces of silver, the price of the one who was valued, valued by the children of Israel;

10.verse: and they gave them for the potter’s field, as the Lord instructed me.

11.verse: Jesus and Barabbas Before Pilate - So Jesus stood in front of the governor. ‘Are you the King of the Jews?’ the governor asked him. ‘If you say so,’ replied Jesus.

12.verse: The chief priests and elders poured out their accusations against him, but he made no answer.

13.verse: Then Pilate said to him, ‘Don’t you hear all this evidence they’re bringing against you?’

14.verse: He gave him no answer, not even a word, which quite astonished the governor.

15.verse: Now the governor had a custom. At festival-time he used to release one prisoner for the crowd, whoever they chose.

16.verse: Just then they had a famous prisoner, called Jesus Barabbas.

17.verse: So when the people were all gathered there, Pilate said to them, ‘Who do you want me to release for you? Jesus Barabbas, or Jesus the so-called Messiah?’

18.verse: (He knew that they’d handed him over out of sheer envy.)

19.verse: While he was presiding in the court, his wife sent a message to him. ‘Don’t have anything to do with that man,’ she said. ‘He’s innocent! I’ve had a really bad time today in a dream, all because of him.’

20.verse: The high priests and the elders persuaded the crowds to ask for Barabbas, and to have Jesus killed.

21.verse: So when the governor came back to them again, and asked, ‘Which of the two do you want me to release for you?’ they said, ‘Barabbas!’

22.verse: ‘So what shall I do with Jesus the so-called Messiah?’ asked Pilate. ‘Let him be crucified!’ they all said.

23.verse: ‘Why?’ asked Pilate. ‘What’s he done wrong?’ But they shouted all the louder, ‘Let him be crucified!’

24.verse: Pilate saw that it was no good. In fact, there was a riot brewing. So he took some water and washed his hands in front of the crowd. ‘I’m not guilty of this man’s blood,’ he said. ‘It’s your problem.’

25.verse: ‘Let his blood be on us!’ answered all the people, ‘and on our children!’

26.verse: Then Pilate released Barabbas for them. He had Jesus flogged, and handed him over to be crucified.

27.verse: Jesus Mocked and Crucified - Then the soldiers of the governor took Jesus into the barracks, and gathered the whole regiment together.

28.verse: They took off his clothes and dressed him up in a scarlet military cloak.

29.verse: They wove a crown out of thorns and stuck it on his head, and put a reed in his right hand. Then they knelt down in front of him. ‘Greetings, King of the Jews!’ they said, making fun of him.

30.verse: They spat on him. Then they took the reed and beat him about the head.

31.verse: When they had finished mocking him, they took off the cloak, dressed him in his own clothes again, and led him off to crucify him.

32.verse: As they were going out they found a man from Cyrene, called Simon. They forced him to carry his cross.

33.verse: When they came to the place called Golgotha, which means Skull-Place,

34.verse: they gave him a drink of wine mixed with bitter herbs. When he tasted it, he refused to drink it.

35.verse: So then they crucified him. They divided up his clothes by casting lots,

36.verse: and they sat down and kept watch over him there.

37.verse: And they placed the written charge above his head: ‘This is Jesus, the King of the Jews.’

38.verse: Then they crucified two brigands alongside him, one on his right and one on his left.

39.verse: Jesus Mocked on the Cross - The people who were going by shouted blasphemies at Jesus. They shook their heads at him.

40.verse: ‘So!’ they said. ‘You were going to destroy the Temple and build it in three days, were you? Save yourself, if you’re God’s son! Come down from the cross!’

41.verse: The chief priests, too, and the scribes and the elders, mocked him.

42.verse: ‘He rescued others,’ they said, ‘but he can’t rescue himself! All right, so he’s the King of Israel! – well, let him come down from the cross right now, and then we’ll really believe that he is!

43.verse: He trusted in God; let God deliver him now, if he’s that keen on him – after all, he did say he was God’s son!’

44.verse: The brigands who were crucified alongside him heaped insults on him as well.

45.verse: The Death of God’s Son - From noon until mid-afternoon there was darkness over the whole land.

46.verse: About the middle of the afternoon Jesus shouted out in a loud voice, ‘Eli, Eli, lema sabachthani!’ – which means, ‘My God, my God, why did you abandon me?’

47.verse: Some of the people who were standing there heard it and said, ‘This fellow’s calling Elijah!’

48.verse: One of them ran at once and got a sponge. He filled it with vinegar, put it on a reed, and gave him a drink.

49.verse: The others said, ‘Wait a bit. Let’s see if Elijah is going to come and rescue him!’

50.verse: But Jesus shouted out loudly one more time, and then breathed his last breath.

51.verse: At that instant the Temple curtain was torn in two, from top to bottom. The earth shook, the rocks were split,

52.verse: and the tombs burst open. Many bodies of the sleeping holy ones were raised.

53.verse: They came out of the tombs after Jesus’ resurrection, and went into the holy city, where they appeared to many people.

54.verse: When the centurion and the others with him, keeping watch over Jesus, saw the earthquake and the things that happened, they were scared out of their wits. ‘He really was God’s son!’ they said.

55.verse: There were several women there, watching from a distance. They had followed Jesus from Galilee, helping to look after his needs.

56.verse: They included Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James and Joseph, and the mother of Zebedee’s sons.

57.verse: The Burial of Jesus - When evening came, a rich man from Arimathea arrived. He was called Joseph, and he, too, was a disciple of Jesus.

58.verse: He went to Pilate and requested the body of Jesus. Pilate gave the order that it should be given to him.

59.verse: So Joseph took the body and wrapped it in a clean linen cloth.

60.verse: He laid it in his own new tomb, which he had carved out of the rock. Then he rolled a large stone across the doorway of the tomb, and went away.

61.verse: Mary Magdalene was there, and so was the other Mary. They were sitting opposite the tomb.

62.verse: On the next day (that is, the day after Preparation Day), the chief priests and the Pharisees went as a group to Pilate.

63.verse: ‘Sir,’ they said, ‘when that deceiver was still alive, we recall that he said, “After three days, I’ll rise again.”

64.verse: So please give the order for the tomb to be made secure until the third day. Otherwise his disciples might come and steal him away, and then tell the people, “He’s been raised from the dead!”, and so the last deception would be worse than the first.’

65.verse: ‘You may have a guard,’ said Pilate; ‘go and make it as secure as you know how.’

66.verse: So they went and made the tomb secure, sealing the stone and putting a guard on watch.

1.verse: The Resurrection of Jesus - Dawn was breaking on the first day of the week; the sabbath was over. Mary Magdalene, and the other Mary, had come to look at the tomb,

2.verse: when suddenly there was a great earthquake. An angel of the Lord came down from heaven. He came to the stone, rolled it away, and sat down on top of it.

3.verse: Looking at him was like looking at lightning, and his clothes were white, like snow.

4.verse: The guards trembled with terror at him, and became like corpses themselves.

5.verse: ‘Don’t be afraid,’ said the angel to the women. ‘I know you’re looking for Jesus, who was crucified.

6.verse: He isn’t here! He’s been raised, as he said he would be! Come and see the place where he was lying –

7.verse: and then go at once, and tell his disciples that he’s been raised from the dead, and that he’s going on ahead of you to Galilee. That’s where you’ll see him. There: I’ve told you.’

8.verse: The women scurried off quickly away from the tomb, in a mixture of terror and great delight, and went to tell his disciples.

9.verse: Suddenly, there was Jesus himself. He met them and said, ‘Greetings!’ They came up to him and took hold of his feet, prostrating themselves in front of him.

10.verse: ‘Don’t be afraid,’ said Jesus to them. ‘Go and tell my brothers that they should go to Galilee. Tell them they’ll see me there.’

11.verse: The Priests and the Guards - While the women were on their way, some of the soldiers who had been on guard went into the city and told the chief priests everything that had happened.

12.verse: They called an emergency meeting with the elders, allotted a substantial sum of money, and gave it to the soldiers.

13.verse: ‘This’, they told them, ‘is what you are to say: “His disciples came in the night, while we were asleep, and stole him away.”

14.verse: And if this gets reported to the governor, we’ll explain it to him and make sure you stay out of trouble.’

15.verse: They took the money and did as they had been instructed. And this story still goes the rounds among the Jews to this day.

16.verse: The Great Commission - So the eleven disciples went off to Galilee, to the mountain where Jesus had instructed them to go.

17.verse: There they saw him, and worshipped him, though some hesitated.

18.verse: Jesus came towards them and addressed them. ‘All authority in heaven and on earth’, he said, ‘has been given to me!

19.verse: So you must go and make all the nations into disciples. Baptize them in the name of the father, and of the son, and of the holy spirit.

20.verse: Teach them to observe everything I have commanded you. And look: I am with you, every single day, to the very end of the age.’
